page.title: 13ABBEYVIEW, PITREAVIE
page.content: As Dunfermline was growing Abbeyview was built round a small hill to the east of Dunfermline town. At the top of the hill is a figure of eight shape. The easterly circle has a large playing area, including a football pitch and near the join of the eight, a clinic, community centre and a pub. The other circle has shops at ground level,with flats above. There is a large Co-operative Store,a few generalshops with a sub post office, a chemist,greengrocer,fish and chip shop,bookmakers,video library,a branch library and a shop with one arm bandits(where you put money in a slot to try games of skill and gambling),this shop also has a snack bar. At the bottom of the hill is Lynburn Primary School attended by all the chilren in the area. Pamela Amos.
